item.title: Ticket #304 (60+ databases errors (in syntax) in step 2 of install latest CVS) closed
item.dc:creator: dougal
item.description:
Not really a WP problem. The table prefix cannot contain a dash, unless the table names in the queries are quoted.

We probably *should* either error check the prefix for disallowed characters, or update all queries to quote table names.

item.title: Ticket #304 (60+ databases errors (in syntax) in step 2 of install latest CVS) updated
item.dc:creator: dougal
item.description:
I believe that the problem might be the use of a dash in your prefix. Try using 'wp_' instead of 'wp-'. From the MySQL docs:

<blockquote> An identifier may be quoted or unquoted. If an identifier is a reserved word or contains special characters, you must quote it whenever you refer to it. For a list of reserved words, see section 10.6 Treatment of Reserved Words in MySQL. Special characters are those outside the set of alphanumeric characters from the current character set, _', and $'. </blockquote>

item.title: Ticket #304 (60+ databases errors (in syntax) in step 2 of install latest CVS) updated
item.dc:creator: mark
item.description: Enter step 2 and 60+ databases errors (in syntax) are printed out. WordPress states it's finished but trying to log in is created with the "doesn't look like you have WordPress installed" screen.

item.title: Ticket #304 (60+ databases errors (in syntax) in step 2 of install latest CVS) created
item.dc:creator: mark
item.description: New database created prior to installation, fresh files from CVS as of this morning. The database errors are attached. I'm running 2 other WordPresses, a CVS from a few days ago as a production (!!!), and 1.2-mingus for testing purposes. They both work fine.

item.title: Changeset [1698]: Fix by Michael Leuchtenburg so that bookmarklet respects pingback setting.
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description: Fix by Michael Leuchtenburg so that bookmarklet respects pingback setting.

item.title: Ticket #303 (Staticize Reloaded plugin causes problems with Gzip enabled) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: I understand that Staticize Reloaded isn't meant to work with Gzip, but I think the plugin should check to see if Gzip is enabled, and disable it, if it is. A lot of people are just going to activate the plugin and be puzzled at the garbled output.

item.title: Ticket #185 (wp-login.php segfaults Apache with PHP5.0.1-dev) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Haaaa, moving the functions out of the switch structure fixed it, thank you skithund :) [Apache 2.0.50, PHP 5.0.1, Windows 2000 Professional]

item.title: Ticket #302 (Category Post Count not decreased when posts deleted) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description:
The categories have "counts" of how many posts are in that category, but their counts remain the same, even when you delete posts in that category.

For example, if you have a category "Funny" and write three posts in that category, then delete all three, it'll say you have 3 "Funny" posts. If you make a new "Funny" post, it'll then say 4.

item.title: Ticket #185 (wp-login.php segfaults Apache with PHP5.0.1-dev) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I have the most recent nightly download of WP ( 09.18 ) I am running windows 2003, iis6, PHP 5.01 and MySQL 4.0.13. I can confirm the login and logout problem. I can also confirm that at times other errors. Below is a list of error I experience and posted over at WP:

Fatal error: Cannot redeclare shutdown_action_hook() (previously declared in D:\web.sites\beach\www\wp-settings.php:86) in D:\web.sites\beach\www\wp-settings.php on line 87

when I go to â€‹http://www.beachblog - if I refresh a few times..

PHP has encountered an Access Violation at 01765C29 Fatal error: Cannot redeclare shutdown_action_hook() (previously declared in D:\web.sites\beach\www\wp-settings.php:86) in D:\web.sites\beach\www\wp-settings.php on line 87 PHP has encountered an Access Violation at 0176B0B7

I just wanted to add my 2cents.

Kind regards, Gravity

item.title: Ticket #185 (wp-login.php segfaults Apache with PHP5.0.1-dev) updated
item.dc:creator: skithund
item.description: Added wp-login.php.diff, which moves login() and checklogin() functions out of switch(). This patch works for me (PHP 5.0.1).

item.title: Ticket #297 (pathinfo RSS permalinks broken) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Dispite that change in CVS, the problem remains.

item.title: Ticket #301 (More control needed over permalinks) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
While the individual entry permalinks can be set up, the text of some of the other permalinks can't be changed without hacking core files. For instance, get_author_link() applies "author/" to author permalinks, and pagination is set at "page/" and search is set at "search/"

It would be nice if these could be configured in the interface.

item.title: Changeset [1697]: If we attempt path info matching but do not match, set 404. Also, ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: If we attempt path info matching but do not match, set 404. Also, retabify some code.

item.title: Ticket #300 (Blank settings when using ?showoptions=all get changed to "0") created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: When viewing the /wp-admin/options.php?showoptions=all "secret" page for changing some of Wordpress' hidden values, certain values will change to 0 if you submit them blank. For instance, if you have your Category Base blank, it'll get set to zero. Also, if you have your blogfilename setting blank, it'll be set to zero. This obviously breaks a lot of your permalinks.
